content: Has anyone had any experience creating PWAs in either Backdrop or D7?

For those who wonder what I'm talking about: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_web_application

Progressive web application - Wikipedia
A progressive web application (PWA) is a type of application software delivered through the web, built using common web technologies including HTML, CSS and JavaScript. It is intended to work on any platform that uses a standards-compliant browser, including both desktop and mobile devices.

Not yet, but there is this: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/pwa/

backdrop-contrib/pwa
Provides basic components to progressively enhance your website with offline functionality. - backdrop-contrib/pwa
Wow, thanks @Laryn! I've been reading up on the D7 module, but never thought to check if it had already been ported :big_smile:
@BWPanda My sense is it may need a little work and has been a "spare time" project so far.
NP, I'll see if I get a chance to play with it in my 'spare time' over the next few weeks.
Well, 'few weeks' turned into a few days :smiling_face: And now I have a working web app on my phone!
Unfortunately I can't show it off because it's a personal budget app/site. And I can't make it public for others to sign up to and use because privacy would be to big a hurdle to bother with.
Yep. Worked mostly well and quite easily. Just added a few issues to the queue, mainly for usability.
I'll see if I can write up a blog post about the process. Might be able to post some doctored screenshots.
